intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium subvladeasae, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of California. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
